intro: Ziziphus baguirmiae, commonly known as the Sahel date tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Sahel region of Africa. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are often consumed by local communities. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it an important resource in dryland ecosystems. Due to its ecological and economic significance, it is also valued for its potential in agroforestry and soil conservation.
